ATLANTA Maurice Laws on,
white man, was shot and
critically wounded when he at
tempted to keep white
restaurant owner from accepting
Negro customers.


Redell Crosby. the cafe owner
was charged with the shooting.
He said Lawson picked up a bottle
and threatened to beat his brains
out.

To Keep Negroes Out

Six white men we're fined SIS
each and sentenced to five days
in jail after they pleaded guilty
to -stoning bus carrying mostly
Negroes in the town. The group
was returning to Pennsylvania
after attending church meeting
in Colorado.


The men ranged from Is to
II years.

PRESIDENT Walker PRESIDENT Alfred CAIN chief edi
tor White Noel Mrde president seated

DENVER : u. S. Secretary of
Interior Stewart L. Udall has
been named "Citizen Of the Year"
by the National Association of
Colored Women Clubs. Inc, and
will address the Associations
annual awards banquet at the Den
ver-Hilton Hotel on July 30. an
nounced by DR.. Rosa L. Gragg.
NACWC national president.


Mr.. Udall's appearance before
the association will mark his
second contact with the national
women's organization in the past
two months. On June rs, the In
terror Secretary was speaker at
ceremonies in Washington, Dc,
in which NACWC decided its
ownership of the Frederick Doug
lass mansion and estate to the
US. Park Service. The estate,
known as Cedar HILL" is now
national shrine in memory Of its
late owner, runaway slave and
militant pre-Civil War abolition
list. After the War Between-the-
States, Douglass served as US.
Marshall for the District Of Col
umbia, Recorder Of Deeds for the
District ofColumbia and Minister
to Haiti.


Following Mrs. Douglass
death in 1916, NACWC at its BIZ
annual convention in Baltimore
formed a nine-member board of
trustees, which assumed the re-
sponsibility of retiring the mort
gage on the "Cedar HIP estate.
At its 1913 convention in Denver,
NACWC burned the mortgage on
the stately l4-acre property,
which overlooks the District of
Columbia. The u. S. Department
of the Interior accepted deed to
the estate on June Is, 1864.


NACWC was formed in 1896
through a merger of the National
Federation of Afro-American
Women's League Of Washington,
DC. To be honored by NACWC
are members of Congress, who
sponsor legislation enabling
the Department of the Interior to
accept the Douglass estate and,
thereby. making it the first ma
tional shrine bearing the name of
a Negro.

NACWC Holds
Annual Meet
In Denver

NEW YORK = Bayard Rustin,
chief planner of last summers
March on Washington is MASTER
minding a huge demonstration for
the Democratic National c owen
ton to be held in Atlantic City,

N. j.. Aug. "a.


Reports say demonstrations
will be aimed at halting the Of
fetal delegations from Missis-
sippi, Alabama and Louisiana
and replacing them with inte-
grated groups.

March Planned For


Demos National Convention

Mr.. and Mrs. Charles Green;
23l7 w. Washington ST.. and their
daughter, Darlene. have returned
from a vacation in the East.


They travelled by train and visi-
ted the New York Worlds Fair.
